it.cnr.isti.hpc.dexter

Interface Tagger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardTagger

    public interface Tagger
    A tagger performs the whole entity linking process. A typical entity linking system performs this task in two steps: spotting and disambiguation.

    The spotting process identifies a set of candidate spots in the input document, and produces a list of candidate entities for each spot.
    Then, the disambiguation process selects the most relevant spots and the most likely entities among the candidates. The spotting step exploits a given catalog of named entities, or some knowledge base, to devise the possible mentions of entities occurring in the input.
    Author:
    Diego Ceccarelli Created on Aug 2, 2013

    • Method Detail

      • tag

        EntityMatchList tag(it.cnr.isti.hpc.dexter.common.Document document)
        Takes a Document performs the entity linking. It returns an {link EntityMatchList}, that maps some spots detected in the document with one (and only one) entity.
        Parameters:
        document - - a document to annotate.

      • tag

        EntityMatchList tag(DexterLocalParams localParams,
                    it.cnr.isti.hpc.dexter.common.Document document)
        Takes a Document performs the entity linking. It returns an {link EntityMatchList}, that maps some spots detected in the document with one (and only one) entity.
        Parameters:
        localParams - contains particular parameters set for this query, can be null
        document - - a document to annotate.
